Rachel B. Baxter
A few good stories, a thousand different versions. My dreams are written in form. http://rbbaxter.com
Apr 12

Responses to the “Awakening Abhanga” Prompt

A Poetry in Form prompt.

As I read the responses to the Awakening Abhanga prompt, the beauty of this form became more and more apparent to me. It has such a musical quality that is perfect for meditative writing as as storytelling. The responses I received are so diverse and different from each other, making this collection such a treat to read. Thank you, poets, I’m really loving these!

Enjoy!

Joel Goodhall

You are like Sunday
Awakening Abhangapoetry-in-form.com

Jack Preston King

3 AM Tornado. My Neighbor Has the Only Basement on the Block, So Everybody Gathers There
An “Awakening Abhanga” Poempoetry-in-form.com

Tamyka Bell

Reluctance
acrostic awakening abhangapoetry-in-form.com

C. Duhnne

Awakened
Abhanga — Rachel B. Baxter’s Awakening Prompt.poetry-in-form.com

Janet Rhodes

Dark Matter
[an abhanga]poetry-in-form.com

Michael Stalcup

Morning Song
An Awakening Abhangapoetry-in-form.com

Willie Ottenwalder

Joyful Awakening
Abhanga Formpoetry-in-form.com

Heath Houston

A New Story
Awakening Abhangapoetry-in-form.com

Abby O. Akoto

Reborn
Awakening Abhangapoetry-in-form.com

Vince

The Fox dance
mirrored four step passing bypoetry-in-form.com
Empress Keizer
Lady in black and whitepoetry-in-form.com
Lord Ollie
Sir Tom catpoetry-in-form.com
Cheeky wake up kiss
redpoetry-in-form.com

Awakening Abhanga
My heart had died insidepoetry-in-form.com

Rachel B. Baxter

Thanks again to all poets who participated in the Awakening Abhanga prompt!

-Rachel
